titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Scott and Gary Show Archive
ca. 1983-1989
MSS 247
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Lawrence Giffin, 2009. Additional media processing by Elizabeth Weist and Rhyannon Rodriguez, 2009.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2012-09-21T17:26-0400

did.unittitle: Scott and Gary Show Archive

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); The Scott and Gary Show Archive; MSS 247; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Collection use is subject to all copyright laws. Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the Director of Fales Library and Special Collections. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu. or call 212 998 2596.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open to researchers. Appointments are necessary for the use of manuscript and archival collections.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into two series:

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content note
scopecontent.p: The Scott and Gary Show Archive comprises materials related to the cable-access show, produced and hosted by Scott Lewis and Gary Winter, that ran from 1983 to 1989. Materials include videotapes of the show; photocopies of a chronology of the series, episode descriptions, correspondence, clippings, and photographs; and videotapes of Jeff Krulik's "A Tribute to the Scott and Gary Show", their appearance on the CBS-TV sitcom "Kate and Allie", and an in-depth video interview with the show's creators.
The collection is arranged into two series:
Series I: Informational Binders. This series contains photocopies of a chronology of the series, episode descriptions, correspondence, clippings, and photographs.

Series II: Video. This series is divided into two subseries. Subseries A contains access copies for the researcher. At present, access copies have not been created for all material. Please contact a Fales archivist. Subseries B contains original video elements.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Scott and Gary Show was a cable access variety show that ran from 1983 to 1989 and featured punk and indie bands, live audience dance parties, and comedy skits. Created and hosted by Scott Lewis and Gary Winter, the show was filmed in New York City from 1983 to 1986 and, at the invitation of cable access producer Jeff Krulik, in the Washington DC metro area, from 1986 to 1989.

The show is notable for early appearances of bands such as the Butthole Surfers and the Beastie Boys (who appear with drummer Kate Schellenbach, later of Luscious Jackson). Other musical guests include the Ben Vaughn Combo, Raunch Hands, Half Japanese, Shockabilly, and Velvet Monkeys.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Twenty videotapes were returned to donor Scot Lewis in September 2012. These deaccessioned materials are indicated in the finding aid. All videotapes were preserved by Fales, except for appearance on "Kate and Allie" television series. The repository holds preservation masters and access viewing copies for all other deaccessioned tapes.
